name: Dead Hang
setup: Grip bar with hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing away (pronated grip)
Jump or step up to hang with arms fully extended
Feet off ground, body hanging relaxed
steps: Hang with arms fully extended, shoulders relaxed
Engage lats slightly to pack shoulders (optional: active hang)
Step or drop down gently when complete
cues: Shoulders packed or relaxed (depending on goal)
mistakes: Shrugging shoulders up toward ears (passive hang only)
Gripping too tight and tensing unnecessarily
safety: If shoulders feel pinched or uncomfortable, reduce hang time or use assisted variation. Great for shoulder decompression and grip strength.

regressions: Assisted dead hang (feet on box or band assistance)
Bent-arm hang (elbows bent, easier on shoulders)
Towel hang (hang from towel over bar for grip work)
progressions: Weighted dead hang (weight belt or dumbbell between feet)
Scapular pull-ups (from dead hang to active hang)

variations: Neutral-grip dead hang (palms facing each other)

prescriptionHints.notes: Hold 20-60s depending on grip strength. Excellent warm-up for pulling exercises or cooldown for shoulder health.

joints.notes: Keep shoulders packed to protect shoulder joint. Avoid if experiencing acute shoulder pain or impingement.
